HORTON, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Unaudited)</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;"> </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="sD108F277716036AF6D582555C0E1E490"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">A</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;"> &#8211; <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-695EDD5BBD24FDBB28C667734E4ABD8B-0-wk-Fact-4C0DA1A3255A7416517867734DA2FB9E" continuedAt="TextSelection-695EDD5BBD24FDBB28C667734E4ABD8B-1" escape="true">BASIS OF PRESENTATION</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-695EDD5BBD24FDBB28C667734E4ABD8B-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-695EDD5BBD24FDBB28C667734E4ABD8B-2"><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:BasisOfPresentationAndSignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock" id="TextSelection-462082447125FE4A2A8667734E4B9B65-0-wk-Fact-32A3EF49BAD8BA29B9E367734D9F617D" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The accompanying unaudited, consolidated financial statements include the accounts of D.R. Horton, Inc. and all of its 100% owned, majority-owned and controlled subsidiaries, which are collectively referred to as the Company, unless the context otherwise requires. Noncontrolling interests represent the proportionate equity interests in consolidated entities that are not 100% owned by the Company. The Company owns a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46699313e606-wk-Fact-9FE1EA7754B5C9F87F3667734D95791D" name="us-gaap:MinorityInterestOwnershipPercentageByParent" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">65</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> controlling interest in Forestar Group Inc. (Forestar) and therefore is required to consolidate 100% of Forestar within its consolidated financial statements, and the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46699313e610-wk-Fact-031FE4810E5EB9443D4767734DA2A465" name="us-gaap:MinorityInterestOwnershipPercentageByNoncontrollingOwners" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">35</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> interest the Company does not own is accounted for as noncontrolling interests. All intercompany accounts, transactions and balances have been eliminated in consolidation.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The financial statements have been prepared in accordance with U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) for interim financial information and with the instructions to Form 10-Q and Article 10 of Regulation S-X. In the opinion of management, these financial statements reflect all adjustments considered necessary to fairly state the results for the interim periods shown, including normal recurring accruals and other items. These financial statements, including the consolidated balance sheet as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, which was derived from audited financial statements, do not include all of the information and notes required by GAAP for complete financial statements and should be read in conjunction with the consolidated financial statements and accompanying notes included in the Company&#8217;s annual report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><br/></span></div></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:PriorPeriodReclassificationAdjustmentDescription" id="TextSelection-C6466B1F4A5C2F20C9B167734E4BDB8E-0-wk-Fact-8EAFC2DD1ED713AD4C1367734DA39141" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Reclassifications</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Certain prior period amounts have been reclassified to conform to the current year presentation. At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company reclassified its single-family rental properties from other assets to property and equipment in its homebuilding segment. Reclassification of the prior period amount resulted in a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46699313e652-wk-Fact-E4A41C93558E18153005C23B840F5E4C" name="us-gaap:PriorPeriodReclassificationAdjustment" contextRef="FD2019Q4QTD_us-gaap_PropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaap_AssetsLeasedToOthersMember_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_srt_SingleFamilyMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">37.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> decrease in other assets with a corresponding increase in property and equipment at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. This reclassification had no effect on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial position or results of operations. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:12pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><br/></span></div></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:UseOfEstimates" id="TextSelection-49ECBF25086A107ACCA767734E4B8DF1-0-wk-Fact-41A6EC4643AFE6A03BA567734DAD4C94" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Use of Estimates</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:30px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The preparation of financial statements in conformity with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions. These estimates and assumptions affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ materially from those estimates.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:12px;font-size:12pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Seasonality</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Historically, the homebuilding industry has experienced seasonal fluctuations; therefore, the operating results for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three months</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> are not necessarily indicative of the results that may be expected for the fiscal year ending </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">September&#160;30, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> or subsequent periods.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:12px;font-size:12pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><br/></span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsAndChangesInAccountingPrinciplesTextBlock" id="TextSelection-8D92EC871C3CD68EDB3567734E4A78DF-0-wk-Fact-0A5535AF624D38BCC13767734D9E4777" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adoption of New Accounting Standard</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:29px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In February 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) issued Accounting Standards Update (ASU) 2016-02, &#8220;Leases,&#8221; which requires that lease assets and liabilities be recognized on the balance sheet and that key information about leasing arrangements be disclosed. The guidance was effective for the Company beginning October 1, 2019 and did not have a material impact on its consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows. As a result of the adoption of this standard on October 1, 2019, the Company recorded right of use assets of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46699313e767-wk-Fact-300DC7B94AA5391E1EA2C2384C3FBCC3" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseRightOfUseAsset" contextRef="I2020Q1SD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">39.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and lease liabilities of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46699313e771-wk-Fact-C9D18E019CDDB7039ED6C238F2B71E57" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseLiability" contextRef="I2020Q1SD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">40.3</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Lease right of use assets are included in other assets and lease liabilities are included in accrued expenses and other liabilities in the consolidated balance sheet.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:30px;font-size:12pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><br/></span></div></ix:nonNumeric></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> 7</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;" href="#s4A73F23552B320F915752555EECDC4E4"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents </span></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">D.R. HORTON, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Unaudited) &#8211; (Continued)</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">December 31, 2019</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-E02282ABE3B9663C6E7B67734E4B0DE3-0-wk-Fact-B7776A0D6173D68B8D3867734DA1B6FD" escape="true"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-695EDD5BBD24FDBB28C667734E4ABD8B-2"><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Pending Accounting Standards</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:29px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In June 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-13, &#8220;Financial Instruments - Credit Losses,&#8221; which replaces the current incurred loss impairment methodology with a methodology that reflects expected credit losses and requires consideration of a broader range of reasonable and supportable information in determining credit loss estimates. The guidance is effective for the Company beginning October&#160;1, 2020 and is not expected to have a material impact on its consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In January 2017, the FASB issued ASU 2017-04, &#8220;Intangibles - Goodwill and Other,&#8221; which simplifies the measurement of goodwill impairment by removing the second step of the goodwill impairment test and requires the determination of the fair value of individual assets and liabilities of a reporting unit. Under the new guidance, goodwill impairment is measured as the amount by which a reporting unit&#8217;s carrying amount exceeds its fair value with the loss recognized limited to the total amount of goodwill allocated to the reporting unit. The guidance is effective for the Company beginning October&#160;1, 2020 and is not expected to have a material impact on its consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:29px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In December 2019, the FASB issued ASU 2019-12 related to simplifying the accounting for income taxes.&#160;The guidance is effective for the Company beginning October 1, 2021, although early adoption is permitted. The Company is currently evaluating the impact of this guidance, and it is not expected to have a material impact on its consolidated financial position, results of operations and cash flows.</span></div></ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:29px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> 8</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="sAB6033EECF2B1518EAF52555C1833DEB"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;" href="#s4A73F23552B320F915752555EECDC4E4"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents </span></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">D.R. HORTON, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Unaudited) &#8211; (Continued)</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">December 31, 2019</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">B</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;"> &#8211; <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:SegmentReportingDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-C84B68C48694CD5847C367734E4B85A0-0-wk-Fact-CD67D0C1F559311F44FE67734E29C416" continuedAt="TextSelection-C84B68C48694CD5847C367734E4B85A0-1" escape="true">SEGMENT INFORMATION</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-C84B68C48694CD5847C367734E4B85A0-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-C84B68C48694CD5847C367734E4B85A0-2"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company is a national homebuilder that is primarily engaged in the acquisition and development of land and the construction and sale of residential homes, with operations in </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46730134e600-wk-Fact-9CA9F2FB3424AF4E3DF167734E086323" name="dhi:NumberOfHousingConstructionMarkets" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_HomeBuildingMember" unitRef="Market" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">90</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> markets across </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46730134e604-wk-Fact-FEBB2620C533DEF7E9CD67734E400415" name="us-gaap:NumberOfStatesInWhichEntityOperates" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_HomeBuildingMember" unitRef="State" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">29</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> states. The Company&#8217;s operating segments are its </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46730134e608-wk-Fact-6A61C872298464EC14C767734E346F75" name="us-gaap:NumberOfOperatingSegments" contextRef="FD2020Q1QTD_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_HomeBuildingMember" unitRef="OperatingDivisions" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">52</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> homebuilding divisions, its majority-owned Forestar residential lot development operations, its financial services operations and its other business activities. The Company&#8217;s reporting segments are its homebuilding reporting segments, its Forestar land development segment and its financial services segment. The homebuilding operating segments are aggregated into the following </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46730134e612-wk-Fact-550EB8E5381E20D1EED267734DA71CC8" name="us-gaap:NumberOfReportableSegments" contextRef="FD2020Q1QTD_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_HomeBuildingMember" unitRef="Segments" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">six</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> reporting segments: East, Midwest, Southeast, South Central, Southwest and West. These reporting segments have homebuilding operations located in the following states:</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Arizona and New Mexico</span></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">West:</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">California, Hawaii, Nevada, Oregon, Utah and Washington</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company&#8217;s homebuilding divisions design, build and sell single-family detached homes on lots they develop and on fully developed lots purchased ready for home construction. To a lesser extent, the homebuilding divisions also build and sell attached homes, such as townhomes, duplexes and triplexes. Most of the revenue generated by the Company&#8217;s homebuilding operations is from the sale of completed homes and to a lesser extent from the sale of land and lots.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:29px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Forestar segment is a residential lot development company with operations in </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46730134e763-wk-Fact-B0898C9FD874ED5AB78167734DB944EE" name="dhi:NumberOfHousingConstructionMarkets" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_ForestarGroupMember" unitRef="Market" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">51</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> markets across </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46730134e767-wk-Fact-DAB357E32A3D48616ABC67734E288F67" name="us-gaap:NumberOfStatesInWhichEntityOperates" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_ForestarGroupMember" unitRef="State" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">20</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> states. Forestar is making significant investments in land acquisition and development to expand its business across a geographically diversified national platform. The homebuilding divisions acquire finished lots from Forestar in accordance with the master supply agreement between the two companies. Forestar&#8217;s segment results are presented on their historical cost basis, consistent with the manner in which management evaluates segment performance.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company&#8217;s financial services segment provides mortgage financing and title agency services to homebuyers in many of the Company&#8217;s homebuilding markets. The segment generates the substantial majority of its revenues from originating and selling mortgages and collecting fees for title insurance agency and closing services. The Company sells substantially all of the mortgages it originates and the related servicing rights to third-party purchasers.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In addition to its homebuilding, Forestar and financial services operations, the Company has subsidiaries that engage in other business activities. These subsidiaries conduct insurance-related operations, construct and own income-producing multi-family rental properties, own non-residential real estate including ranch land and improvements and own and operate oil and gas related assets. The operating results of these subsidiaries are immaterial for separate reporting and therefore are grouped together and presented as other. One of these subsidiaries, DHI Communities, constructs multi-family rental properties and has </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46730134e782-wk-Fact-4EC6345060C41CD1ECAE67734E3F49A2" name="dhi:NumberofProjects" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_PropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaap_AssetUnderConstructionMember_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_AllOtherSegmentsMember_us-gaap_SubsegmentsAxis_srt_MultifamilyMember" unitRef="Projects" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">four</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> projects under active construction and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46730134e786-wk-Fact-8E9C1172DA9FF7A4B22567734E05A92D" name="dhi:NumberofProjects" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_PropertyPlantAndEquipmentByTypeAxis_us-gaap_AssetsLeasedToOthersMember_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_AllOtherSegmentsMember_us-gaap_SubsegmentsAxis_srt_MultifamilyMember" unitRef="Projects" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">one</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> project that was substantially complete at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. In November 2019, DHI Communities sold a multi-family rental property for </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46730134e794-wk-Fact-B027692C24D2E384144FC1DEFC160685" name="us-gaap:ProceedsFromSaleOfBuildings" contextRef="FD2020Q1QTD_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_AllOtherSegmentsMember_us-gaap_SubsegmentsAxis_srt_MultifamilyMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">61.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and recorded a gain on the sale of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46730134e798-wk-Fact-9B72037459F297224936C1E138B8AC98" name="us-gaap:GainLossOnSaleOfProperties" contextRef="FD2020Q1QTD_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_AllOtherSegmentsMember_us-gaap_SubsegmentsAxis_srt_MultifamilyMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">31.2</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the consolidated balance sheets included </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46730134e811-wk-Fact-9132D65B20DDC24BDB0867734E31F5C8" name="us-gaap:Assets" HORTON, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Unaudited) &#8211; (Continued)</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">December 31, 2019</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-65A27488D6AB991EEC6D67734E4C5BB4-2" continuedAt="TextSelection-65A27488D6AB991EEC6D67734E4C5BB4-3"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company&#8217;s homebuilding revolving credit facility imposes restrictions on its operations and activities, including requiring the maintenance of a maximum allowable leverage ratio and a borrowing base restriction if the leverage ratio exceeds a certain level. These covenants are measured as defined in the credit agreement governing the facility and are reported to the lenders quarterly. A failure to comply with these financial covenants could allow the lending banks to terminate the availability of funds under the revolving credit facility or cause any outstanding borrowings to become due and payable prior to maturity. The credit agreement governing the facility and the indenture governing the senior notes also impose restrictions on the creation of secured debt and liens. At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company was in compliance with all of the covenants, limitations and restrictions of its homebuilding revolving credit facility and public debt obligations.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">D.R. Horton has an automatically effective universal shelf registration statement filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">August 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, registering debt and equity securities that the Company may issue from time to time in amounts to be determined.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">October 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company issued </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1807-wk-Fact-BFABF01008632C93D565C1F8E417159D" name="us-gaap:NotesPayable" contextRef="I2020Q1SD_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_dhi_SeniorNoteFortyTwoMember_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_HomeBuildingMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">500</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> principal amount of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1811-wk-Fact-55BDC46DC95FE5F2A730C1F7A93BA1A7" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="I2020Q1SD_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_dhi_SeniorNoteFortyTwoMember_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_HomeBuildingMember" unitRef="number" decimals="3" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2.5</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> senior notes due </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">October&#160;15, 2024</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, with interest payable semi-annually. The annual effective interest rate of these notes after giving effect to the amortization of the discount and financing costs is </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1819-wk-Fact-126AB353108237C5D2A0C1F9C315ED5A" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateEffectivePercentage" contextRef="I2020Q1SD_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_dhi_SeniorNoteFortyTwoMember_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_HomeBuildingMember" unitRef="number" decimals="3" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2.7</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Effective </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">July&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Board of Directors authorized the repurchase of up to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1832-wk-Fact-6FDB217704AAD67A135167734DED9A03" name="dhi:AuthorizedRepurchaseOfDebtSecurities" contextRef="FD2019Q4QTD_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_us-gaap_HomeBuildingMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">500</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of the Company&#8217;s debt securities. that could increase the size of the facility to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1859-wk-Fact-572ED29426E02039EDED67734DAC5E7B" The facility also provides for the issuance of letters of credit with a sublimit equal to the greater of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1863-wk-Fact-95B7DADB03B1158576E967734DFA1F0F" name="dhi:LetterofCreditMaximumBorrowingCapacityindollars" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_ForestarGroupMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">100</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1867-wk-Fact-021FC26F26C82B7913B167734DAD8B7C" name="dhi:LetterofCreditMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_ForestarGroupMember" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">50</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of the revolving credit commitment. Borrowings under the revolving credit facility are subject to a borrowing base based on Forestar&#8217;s book value of its real estate assets and unrestricted cash. Letters of credit issued under the facility reduce the available borrowing capacity. At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, there were </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1876-wk-Fact-7A20FFA84A07A5B4D1A267734E186678" name="us-gaap:LineOfCredit" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_ForestarConsolidatedMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">no</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> borrowings outstanding and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1880-wk-Fact-AF30C85033B367347B2667734DA94709" name="us-gaap:LettersOfCreditOutstandingAmount" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_ForestarGroupMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">28.7</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of letters of credit issued under the revolving credit facility, resulting in available capacity of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1884-wk-Fact-C344AD399D9612212AB7C20C47EA7672" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityRemainingBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_ForestarGroupMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">351.3</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The maturity date of the facility is </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">October 2, 2022</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, which can be extended by up to one year on up to two additional occasions, subject to the approval of lenders holding a majority of the commitments.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Forestar revolving credit facility includes customary affirmative and negative covenants, events of default and financial covenants. The financial covenants require Forestar to maintain a minimum level of tangible net worth, a minimum level of liquidity and a maximum allowable leverage ratio. These covenants are measured as defined in the credit agreement governing the facility and are reported to the lenders quarterly. A failure to comply with these financial covenants could allow the lending banks to terminate the availability of funds under the revolving credit facility or cause any outstanding borrowings to become due and payable prior to maturity. At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, Forestar was in compliance with all of the covenants, limitations and restrictions of its revolving credit facility.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the principal amount of Forestar&#8217;s </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1910-wk-Fact-51A0F0C524A67B8E25F967734DF33422" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_dhi_SeniorNoteMemberFortyMember_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_ForestarGroupMember" unitRef="number" decimals="INF" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">3.75</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> convertible senior notes was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1914-wk-Fact-3F2819A0FC714E18BAE9C20D146FA043" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFaceAmount" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_dhi_SeniorNoteMemberFortyMember_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_ForestarGroupMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">118.9</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Forestar intends to settle these notes in cash upon their maturity on </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">March&#160;1, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, with any excess conversion value to be settled in shares of its common stock. At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, Forestar was in compliance with all of the limitations and restrictions associated with its senior note obligations.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Forestar&#8217;s revolving credit facility, its senior notes and its convertible senior notes are not guaranteed by D.R. Horton, Inc. or any of the subsidiaries that guarantee the Company&#8217;s homebuilding debt.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> 17</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><a style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;" href="#s4A73F23552B320F915752555EECDC4E4"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Table of Contents </span></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">D.R. HORTON, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Unaudited) &#8211; (Continued)</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">December 31, 2019</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-65A27488D6AB991EEC6D67734E4C5BB4-3"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Financial Services:</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:16px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company&#8217;s mortgage subsidiary, DHI Mortgage, has a mortgage repurchase facility that provides financing and liquidity to DHI Mortgage by facilitating purchase transactions in which DHI Mortgage transfers eligible loans to the counterparties upon receipt of funds from the counterparties. DHI Mortgage then has the right and obligation to repurchase the purchased loans upon their sale to third-party purchasers in the secondary market or within specified time frames from </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">45</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">60 days</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in accordance with the terms of the mortgage repurchase facility. The total capacity of the facility is </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1950-wk-Fact-9FDA163AAE14EC5A94D067734DFB0E59" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityCurrentBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_FinancialServicesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">900</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, which can be increased to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1954-wk-Fact-9FC140B80763DA58839B67734DA157FC" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_FinancialServicesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-8" scale="9" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.2</ix:nonFraction> billion</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> subject to the availability of additional commitments. In </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company received an additional commitment of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1963-wk-Fact-13823E905A11DD6655D6C48AF4FCE0D5" name="dhi:TemporaryIncreaseInBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_FinancialServicesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">50</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> increasing the total capacity of the facility to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1967-wk-Fact-18E88A922DF218E249E4C48A58FED0E0" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityCurrentBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_FinancialServicesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="INF" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">950</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The additional commitment expired on </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;26, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The Company is currently in discussions with its lenders and expects to renew and extend the facility on similar terms prior to its </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">February&#160;21, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> maturity date.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1988-wk-Fact-1D1F519465ACA11C2A3A67734DC39165" name="us-gaap:PledgedFinancialInstrumentsNotSeparatelyReportedLoansReceivablePledgedForRepurchaseAgreements" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_FinancialServicesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">953.7</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of mortgage loans held for sale with a collateral value of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1992-wk-Fact-6B2B6254BA0212D869FF67734DF1AA21" name="us-gaap:ParticipatingMortgageLoansMortgageObligationsAmount" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_FinancialServicesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">915.1</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> were pledged under the mortgage repurchase facility. DHI Mortgage had an obligation of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e1996-wk-Fact-1C91DFFB270AA7D4076B67734DC39C25" name="us-gaap:NotesPayable" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_FinancialServicesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">850.2</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> outstanding under the mortgage repurchase facility at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> at a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46705630e2005-wk-Fact-1E2423833E27B0942E9867734DC37A63" name="us-gaap:AssetsSoldUnderAgreementsToRepurchaseInterestRate" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_dhi_FinancialServicesMember" unitRef="number" decimals="3" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">3.5</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> annual interest rate.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The mortgage repurchase facility is not guaranteed by D.R. Horton, Inc. or any of the subsidiaries that guarantee the Company&#8217;s homebuilding debt. The facility contains financial covenants as to the mortgage subsidiary&#8217;s minimum required tangible net worth, its maximum allowable leverage ratio and its minimum required liquidity. These covenants are measured and reported to the lenders monthly. At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, DHI Mortgage was in compliance with all of the conditions and covenants of the mortgage repurchase facility.</span></div></ix:continuation><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="s797A37830D02B02885412555C10C4953"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTE </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">E</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;"> &#8211; <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="dhi:CapitalizedInterestTextBlock" id="TextSelection-7B6747D39E21C7466FBE67734E4C75BA-0-wk-Fact-0CD5D1B7656B5CFF716C67734DEF8C61" continuedAt="TextSelection-7B6747D39E21C7466FBE67734E4C75BA-1" escape="true">CAPITALIZED INTEREST</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-7B6747D39E21C7466FBE67734E4C75BA-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-7B6747D39E21C7466FBE67734E4C75BA-2"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company capitalizes interest costs incurred to inventory during active development and construction (active inventory). Capitalized interest is charged to cost of sales as the related inventory is delivered to the buyer. During periods in which the Company&#8217;s active inventory is lower than its debt level, a portion of the interest incurred is reflected as interest expense in the period incurred. During the first </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three months</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of fiscal </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company&#8217;s active inventory exceeded its debt level, and all interest incurred was capitalized to inventory.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="dhi:CapitalizedInterestCostsTableTextBlock" id="TextSelection-2D5567957283EC3F9BDA67734E4C33CF-0-wk-Fact-A7EFFFE103FDC671B7A567734DF3854D" continuedAt="TextSelection-2D5567957283EC3F9BDA67734E4C33CF-1" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three months</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> ended </span><span loans held for sale consist primarily of single-family residential loans collateralized by the underlying property. At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, mortgage loans held for sale had an aggregate carrying value and aggregate outstanding principal balance of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46706243e604-wk-Fact-102A59D00788101E7E33CE63E646017A" name="us-gaap:LoansReceivableHeldForSaleNetNotPartOfDisposalGroup" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-8" scale="9" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.0</ix:nonFraction> billion</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-4870524BE4485D3DA17D67734E4C2FC5-0-wk-Fact-18A8CFD271BD528F0CAE67734DB9C524" continuedAt="TextSelection-4870524BE4485D3DA17D67734E4C2FC5-1" escape="true">INCOME TAXES</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-4870524BE4485D3DA17D67734E4C2FC5-1"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company&#8217;s income tax expense for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three months</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46706436e612-wk-Fact-5AABF230AF78CC60CD5467734E415F05" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">90.8</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46706436e616-wk-Fact-DB2A174ABD7B0A4A7CF567734D344E6D" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit" contextRef="FD2019Q1QTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">89.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively. The effective tax rate was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46706436e621-wk-Fact-2F35DD786FB660892D6867734DBDC6C2" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="number" decimals="3" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">17.4</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three months</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> compared to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d46706436e633-wk-Fact-06114F1A4B9574EA27EB67734DBA8F67" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="FD2019Q1QTD" unitRef="number" decimals="3" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">23.7</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in the prior year period. The effective tax rate for the three months ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> includes a tax benefit of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46706436e641-wk-Fact-B7698B43AB37FC387386C3DAE437888D" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxReconciliationTaxCreditsOther" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">32.9</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> from the enactment of the Taxpayer Certainty and Disaster Tax Relief Act of 2019 (the Act). The Act retroactively reinstated the federal energy efficient homes tax credit that expired on </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2017</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> to homes closed from </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;1, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The effective tax rates for both periods include an expense for state income taxes, reduced by tax benefits related to stock-based compensation.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company&#8217;s deferred tax assets, net of deferred tax liabilities, were </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46706436e663-wk-Fact-7738FC8FE312F6913C0967734DBDF106" name="dhi:DeferredTaxAssetsNetOfDeferredTaxLiabilities" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">172.4</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> compared to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46706436e671-wk-Fact-EDF044972372A355635D67734DB81AA6" name="dhi:DeferredTaxAssetsNetOfDeferredTaxLiabilities" contextRef="FI2019Q4" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">181.8</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The Company has a valuation allowance of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46706436e679-wk-Fact-31F642997A9228A4E51667734E1F65CA" name="us-gaap:DeferredTaxAssetsValuationAllowance" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">18.3</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d46706436e688-wk-Fact-2D8E00C32F22AA76AF3767734D51DCD2" name="us-gaap:DeferredTaxAssetsValuationAllowance" contextRef="FI2019Q4" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">18.7</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> related to state deferred tax assets for net operating loss (NOL) carryforwards that are more likely than not to expire before being realized. The Company will continue to evaluate both the positive and negative evidence in determining the need for a valuation allowance with respect to the remaining state NOL carryforwards. Any reversal of the valuation allowance in future periods will impact the Company&#8217;s effective tax rate.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The accounting for deferred taxes is based upon estimates of future results. Differences between the anticipated and actual outcomes of these future results could have a material impact on the Company&#8217;s consolidated results of operations or financial position. Also, changes in existing federal and state tax laws and tax rates could affect future tax results and the valuation of the Company&#8217;s deferred tax assets.</span></div></ix:continuation><div
